name: Medorrhinum
Relationship: Compare: (Lactation: GALEGA; LACTUCA.) SULPH.; SYPHIL.; ZINC.

Stool: Can pass stool only by leaning very far back
Painful lump sensation on posterior surface of sphincter
Head: Headache from jarring of ears, exhaustion, or hard work
Burning pain in brain; worse, occiput
Itching of scalp; dandruff
Head heavy and drawn backward
Weight and pressure in vertex
Hair dry, crispy
Fever: Flashes of heat in face and neck
Chills up and down back; coldness of legs, hands, and forearms
Wants to be fanned all the time
Stomach: Cravings for liquor, salt, sweets, etc., warm drinks
Coppery taste and eructations of sulfuretted hydrogen
Abdomen: Violent pain in liver and spleen
Rests more comfortably lying on abdomen
Mouth: Tongue coated brown and thick, blistered; canker sores
Blisters on inner surface of lips and cheeks
Respiratory: Pain and soreness through chest and mammae
Eyes: Feels as if sticks in eyes
Feels as if she stared at everything
Face: Small boils break out during menses
Pallor, acne, blotches of redding color
Male: Nocturnal emissions, followed by great weakness
Enlarged and painful prostrate with frequent urging and painful urination
Ears: Quick, darting pains in right ear
Mind: Fear in the dark and of someone behind her
Female: Leucorrhoea thick, acrid, excoriating, fishy odor
Menses offensive, profuse, dark, clotted; stains difficult to wash out, urinates frequently at that time
Ovarian pain, worse left side, or from ovary to ovary
Skin: Intense and incessant itching; worse night and when thinking of it
Fiery red rash about anus in babies
Extremities: Pain in back, with burning heat
Legs heavy, ache all night, cannot keep them still
Heels and balls of feet tender

details: A powerful and deep-acting medicine, often indicated for chronic ailments due to suppressed gonorrhea. For women with chronic pelvic disorders. Chronic RHEUMATISM. Great disturbance and irritability of nervous system. Pains intolerable, tensive; nerves quiver and tingle. Children dwarfed and stunted. Chronic catarrhal conditions in children. Nose dirty, tonsils enlarged, thick yellow mucus from nostrils; lips thickened from mouth breathing. State of collapse and TREMBLING ALL OVER. History of sycosis. Often restores a gonorrheal discharge. Intensity of all sensations. Oedema of limbs; dropsy of serous sacs. Disseminated sclerosis.
